intro: Silene monerantha, commonly known as the single-flowered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its simple, erect stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Silene monerantha is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments and is known for its delicate appearance.
